question: Who among the following appoints / elect the Pro Tem speaker in India?
explanation: The Lok Sabha speaker needs to quit the office before the first meeting of the newly elected Lok Sabha. At this point of time, a speaker <u>Pro Tem is appointed by the President</u>. Speaker Pro Tem presides over the first sitting of the newly-elected Lok Sabha and administers oath to the new members. His officer ceases to exist when new Speaker is elected by the House.
